description:
Hi guys, 
running OpenStack on essex, version 2012.1~e3+dfsg+1-2
The package novnc refuses to start since the user running the process doesn't have the rights to create the PID file
Into /etc/init.d/novnc

Line 
PIDFILE=/var/run/$NAME.pid

should be 
PIDFILE=/var/run/nova/$NAME.pid

Otherwise the service doesn't start
title: novnc init script wrong variable

comments.content:
Hi guys, 
running OpenStack on essex, version 2012.1~e3+dfsg+1-2
The package novnc refuses to start since the user running the process doesn't have the rights to create the PID file
Into /etc/init.d/novnc

Line 
PIDFILE=/var/run/$NAME.pid

should be 
PIDFILE=/var/run/nova/$NAME.pid

Otherwise the service doesn't start
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~razique

comments.content:
On Ubuntu precise sorry, using the official PPA.
What extra informations do you need ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~razique

comments.content: Doesn't look like a nova issue, but rather a novnc packaging issue.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx
